issues.description: The problem statement repeatedly refers to the REST endpoint paths including an "/api" prefix (e.g. "PUT /api/persons/{personId}/parents", lines 125-126 in the problem statement), but both the template and solution code (PersonResource) register endpoints at "persons/..." without an "/api" prefix. This mismatch between the documented endpoint paths and the actual controller mappings (and the integration tests in the repositories, which call "/persons/...") can confuse students about which URL to call or test against.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the documentation and code consistent. Either (A) update the problem statement to refer to "/persons/{...}" (remove the "/api" prefix), or (B) add a common base path to the controllers (e.g. change @RequestMapping(...) to @RequestMapping(path = "/api", consumes = ..., produces = ...) in PersonResource and TestingResource) so that endpoints are actually available under "/api/persons/...". Also update any example calls in the problem text to match the chosen convention.

issues.description: In the template PersonResource the handler for updating a person is annotated with @PutMapping("persons/{personId}") but the method signature does not accept the path variable (method: updatePerson(@RequestBody Person updatedPerson)). The solution adds the corresponding @PathVariable parameter and checks that updatedPerson.getId().equals(personId). This mismatch (mapping declares a path variable but the template method does not bind it) is a structural inconsistency between template and solution and may confuse students about the expected method signature and validation.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the template's updatePerson signature match the mapping and the solution: add the @PathVariable Long personId parameter and (optionally) validate that updatedPerson.getId().equals(personId), throwing a BAD_REQUEST ResponseStatusException if they differ. Alternatively, if the path variable should not be used, remove "{personId}" from the @PutMapping path to avoid declaring an unused path variable.

issues.description: The problem statement refers to the REST endpoint using the path prefix "/api" (e.g. "PUT /api/persons/{personId}/parents") while both the template and the solution map the endpoints to "/persons/{personId}/parents" (no "/api" prefix). This discrepancy between the documented endpoint path and the actual controller mappings can confuse students about which URL to use when calling the API in integration tests or when manually exercising the service.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the endpoint paths consistent. Either (A) update the problem statement to reference the actual paths used in the code (e.g. "PUT /persons/{personId}/parents"), or (B) add the "/api" base path to the controllers by specifying a path on the class-level @RequestMapping (for example: @RequestMapping(path = "/api", consumes = ..., produces = ...)) so that the code matches the documented endpoints. Choose one approach and apply it across all REST endpoint references and tests.
